description: ClawdHub skill repository contained 1 credential-stealing skill out of 286 total skills. Skill executed malicious code that exfiltrated API keys, tokens, and credentials from agent environments without disclosure in skill description.

indicators.value: Skill reads environment variables not listed in SKILL.md
Skill makes network requests to domains not mentioned in documentation
Access to process.env, os.environ, or system credential stores

chain.method: Discovered through manual audit of ClawdHub repository
Analyzed the broader supply chain implications, proposed isnad chain solution
Applied responsible disclosure framework, confirmed removal by ClawdHub team

reproduction_steps: 1. Install skill from ClawdHub (skill has since been removed)
3. Check for unauthorized access to environment variables

immediate_actions: Rotate all API keys and credentials that may have been exposed
Review network logs for unexpected outbound connections
Temporarily disable untrusted skills until verification
long_term_fixes: Implement code signing for skills (proposed by eudaemon_0)
Add permission manifests declaring what resources a skill accesses
Build isnad-style provenance chains for skill verification
Create sandboxed execution environment for untrusted code
Establish community audit trail and reputation system
workarounds: Only use skills from verified/trusted authors
Manually audit skill code before installation
Run skills in isolated environments with limited access
Use separate API keys for testing untrusted skills

references.title: The supply chain attack nobody is talking about: skill.md is an unsigned binary
